SMW Subobject for UnchargedHigh Alchemy value: 12120Buy limit: 10000Examine: You will need to recharge the necklace at the Legends Guild.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Skills necklaceImage: File:Skills necklace (uncharged).pngUses infobox: ItemWeight: 0.010Value: 20200Version anchor: UnchargedRelease date: 30 April 2007Item ID: 11113

A skills necklace is a dragonstone necklace that has been enchanted with the Lvl-5 Enchant spell. When charged, a worn skills necklace provides a slight increase to the chance of finding a casket whilst fishing with a big net.

The skills necklace can be recharged by using it on the totem pole in the Legends' Guild, or on the Fountain of Uhld in the Myths' Guild, with either giving it four charges - the player must have completed Legends' Quest or Dragon Slayer II to do so, respectively. It can also be recharged on the Fountain of Rune in the Wilderness, giving it six charges which also requires completion of Legends' Quest. Alternatively, the Recharge Dragonstone Lunar spell can be cast giving it four charges, requiring the Fremennik Hard Diaries to use.

Skills necklace112,272
Profit−120
  1. ↑ Manual casting is 3 ticks, auto-casting is 7 ticks

Teleportation options[edit | edit source]

The necklace can carry up to four charges (six if recharged at the Fountain of Rune), each of which can be used to teleport to the entrances of one of six locations:

Destination Map
Fishing Guild
Mining Guild
Crafting Guild
Cooks' Guild
Woodcutting Guild
Farming Guild[1]
  1. ↑ The teleport takes players inside the guild if their Farming level is at least 45 and their Hosidius favour is 60% or greater, otherwise players are teleported outside the guild

Like the other enchanted pieces of dragonstone jewellery, the teleports of a skills necklace can be used in up to level 30 Wilderness, instead of level 20, the normal limit for teleportation. However, the skills necklace, being a piece of jewellery that focuses on noncombat skills, gives no combat bonuses.

Price per teleport[edit | edit source]

It often is cheaper to purchase a Skills necklace with 6 charges, after accounting for the sale of the uncharged necklace. Below is a table that shows the current price, price per teleport, the money loss after selling the uncharged necklace, and finally the cost per teleport after adjusting for selling the uncharged necklace.

Item Necklace Cost Total Loss Cost Per Teleport
Skills necklace(6) 12,553 −281 −47
Skills necklace(4) 12,386 −114 −29

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
10 January 2019
(update)

A teleport to the Farming Guild is now available.

4 January 2018
(update)

You can now recharge most dragonstone jewellery at the Fountain of Uhld.

31 August 2017
(update)

Partially charged versions of the item could now be turned into bank placeholders.

22 June 2017
(update)
  • The teleport to the Mining Guild is moved slightly.
  • The "Motherlode Mine" option while equipped was renamed to "Mining Guild".
9 February 2017
(update | poll)

The uncharged version of various pieces of jewellery is made darker.

28 July 2016
(update | poll)

A teleport to the Woodcutting Guild is now available.

6 July 2016
(update)

You can now recharge most dragonstone jewellery with a charge dragonstone jewellery scroll.

8 October 2015
(update)

The mining guild teleport was replaced with a motherlode mine teleport.

24 September 2015
(update)

Corrected some grammar in the skills necklace teleport message.

5 March 2015
(update)

You can now recharge most dragonstone jewellery by casting Recharge Dragonstone.

26 February 2015
(update)

Partially charged versions of the item were made untradeable on the Trading Post/Grand Exchange.

27 March 2014
(update | poll)

You can now recharge dragonstone jewellery at the Fountain of Rune, giving it a new maximum of 6 charges.
